content:
by  Sabrina Romano  Staff Writer February  

Heinz Memorial Chapel is currently undergoing a  preservation process according to Pat Gibbons at the Heinz Chapel Office PERIOD

SSM Industries Inc PERIOD is installing a climate control system in the chapel Gibbons said PERIOD The project was started in December  and is expected to be completed in May  PERIOD

The objective is to achieve humidity and even temperature control University spokesman John Fedele said PERIOD

Heinz Chapel was built by architect Charles Klauder and was dedicated by the Heinz family on Nov PERIOD   PERIOD University organist Robert S PERIOD Lord and Chatham College organist Russell G PERIOD Wichmann dedicated the current organ on March   PERIOD The current organ replaced the original organ which was damaged in the 1960s PERIOD

The climate control system will help preserve the organ stained glass and interior woodwork Fedele said and the University has taken proper precautions to make sure that the organ and stained glass are not damaged during the preservations PERIOD

The organ itself was professionally demounted crated and stored to prevent any damage and will be remounted at the end of the project Fedele said PERIOD
